column13: Carbon markets play an integral role in creating an economic incentive to reduce emissions and decarbonise the economy, including establishing a market price for carbon. Through its carbon trading desk, Westpac is a key participant in the Renewable Energy Certificates market in Australia and carbon markets in Australia and New Zealand.

column13: Scenario analysis informs how Westpac assesses and manages climate-related risks over the short, medium, and long term. Westpac uses climate-related scenario analysis and stress testing to understand its lending portfolios and exposure to high-emitting sectors. Westpac also uses science-based reference scenarios to help understand the sectoral decarbonisation pathways and targets to transition to net zero by 2050.
column20: Climate-related scenario analysis, stress testing, decarbonisation pathway

column13: Westpac provided financing support for the new Rangebank Battery Energy Storage System in Cranbourne, Victoria. Eku Energy and Shell Energy Operations are developing this greenfield project and, once fully operational, will have the storage capacity to power 80,000 homes for an hour during peak periods.
column20: Rangebank Battery Energy Storage System, financing support, storage capacity

column13: Westpac and BankSA have been proud to be the transition partner of choice for South Australia-based Kambitsis Group, which chose to retrofit and transform two office buildings at 150 Grenfell Street, Adelaide, into a premium Property Council Australia A-Grade commercial space. The project, due for completion in 2024, is expected to be all-electric and carbon-neutral certified in construction and operation. column13: Westpac's Sustainability Risk Management Framework (SRMF) sets out its approach to managing sustainability risks relating to climate change, human rights, and the environment and supports the Board-approved RMF. Westpac uses a Board-approved Risk Taxonomy to classify and categorise its material risks and the sub-categories of those risks. Sustainability risks, including climate change, have the potential to affect the company in various ways, with the main impacts classified under the material risks of Credit Risk (as a financial risk) and Reputation and Sustainability Risk (as a non-financial risk).

column13: Westpac asked its people what they valued most about being a Westpac employee. Four clear themes emerged around 'care for our people', 'flexible work', 'skills and expertise', and 'advocating for positive change'. These themes will form part of Westpac's refreshed Employee Value Proposition (EVP), shaping activities focused on retaining and attracting talent over the coming year.

column6: New employee hires and employee turnover
column13: Diverse hiring practices help Westpac address talent gaps and broaden Westpac's perspectives to enhance innovation. Westpac is the first financial institution in Australia to obtain the Disability Confident Recruiter accreditation. Westpac also improved its candidate hiring processes to provide equitable experiences for individuals living with an injury, illness or disability, including neurodiverse candidates.
column20: Disability Confident Recruiter, diverse hiring practice, talent gap
